entry.title: Configuration and Submission of your UK VAT Return
entry.content:
In this blog post, I would like to guide you on how to configure and integrate SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition with your business system to electronically submit the VAT return to the tax authorities in the United Kingdom.

One of the values of integrating your business systems with the cloud edition is the fact that the integration between systems needs to be done only once ‚Äì after you are done, the systems are integrated and available for all of your reports.

This means that once you have completed the configuration specific for your reporting entity and made the communication settings specific for your tax authority, a single click in the Run Statutory Reports app submits the report from your business system and triggers the entire flow to electronically submit the VAT return report to HMRC, the tax authority.

For detailed information on how to integrate your business system with the cloud edition, you can access the Setup communication for electronic submission of s... - SAP Community blog post.

When doing the process-specific configuration, you are required to enter your HMRC credentials in the Manage Communication Settings app. If you're VAT-registered, HMRC automatically signs up new businesses for MTD for VAT, unless you're exempt or have applied for exemption. In both cases, consider the following:

  • Use compatible software: You must keep your digital VAT records and submit VAT returns using MTD-compatible software. SAP S/4HANA products provide the end-to-end process of recording your financial transactions, generating the VAT return, and submitting the report electronically using the mandated API from HMRC in the correct JSON file format.
  • Sign in with your Government Gateway ID: This is your credential for accessing HMRC services. If you don‚Äôt have one, you can create a Government Gateway account. For more information, see Create a Government Gateway account.
  • Link your software to HMRC: Authorize your system to communicate with HMRC using your Government Gateway credentials. For more information, see Granting Permission to Submit the VAT Return Report Electronically.

When performing the steps in the Manage Communication Settings app of the cloud edition, you enter your credentials for the UK MTD, that is, your VAT registration number. For more information, see Managing Communication Settings.

In your first submission, you will be prompted to enter your credentials in the HMRC portal. You will see a message asking if SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition, is authorized to access the HMRC portal. Please select "Yes".

For 18 months after the initial authorization, you will not need to enter a username and password for submissions again. The VAT return report is submitted as soon as you select the Submit option in the Run Statutory Reports app. However, the authorization needs to be renewed every 18 months. 

If, within those 18 months, the authorization grants are not valid at the time of submission for any reason, you will be redirected to HMRC to renew the access tokens before submission can take place.

 

END-TO-END PROCESS

Once you have integrated both systems and made the process-specific configuration, you can generate and submit the VAT return report to HMRC, as follows:

1 ‚Äì Access the Run Statutory Reports app and enter the following parameters:

  • Reporting Entity
  • Report Name: GB_VAT_DCL
  • Reporting Year

2 - Choose Go.

 

3 - After running and completing the activities listed, for example, Manage Tax Items, select the Prepare VAT Return Statement (Great Britain) activity.

 

4 - Select New Run, check the default selection criteria, and make changes if required.

 

5 - After executing the report and checking the VAT return statement, choose Submit.

 

TROUBLESHOOTING

[1] If you are moving from SAP Document and Reporting Compliance service to SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition, you can find more information in  Moving to SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, Cloud Edition.

Be aware that you have to apply all referred SAP Notes and prerequisites of SAP Note 3386362 - UK VAT Return Submission: Implementation Overview.

For more information, you can also access the Frequently Asked Questions section of the Moving to SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, Cloud Edition. See Frequently Asked Questions.

 

[2] To enforce a new redirection:

1. Access the Manage Communication Settings - External Parties app in SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition.

2. Search by your Identification number and choose the respective entry.

3.  Choose the ‚ÄúX‚Äù (Delete Key) from the Authentication Setting section. A pop-up window appears, and you confirm your action.

 

 

 4. The authentication setting status is updated to ‚ÄúIncomplete‚Äù.

 

 5. Choose + (‚ÄúAdd Authentication Setting‚Äù) and, in the pop-up window, choose Authorization Code Flow as the authentication setting.

 

 

 6. The authentication setting status is updated to ‚ÄúComplete‚Äù.

 

Wait a few minutes before submitting your report to allow any cached items to be erased.

7. You can now resubmit your report using the Run Statutory Reports app. 

[3] Testing with HMRC is not supported

The tax authority in the United Kingdom (HMRC) doesn't provide a test environment in which you can test the submission process. You can, however, with a test subscription of SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition, test the connection between the cloud edition with your business system.  

Once you have configured the integration in the test environment, you can simulate the submission of UK-MTD from a reporting entity in the Run Statutory Reports. This proves the environment is configured properly.

 * Please note there is no communication with HMRC in this type of test.

* The Submit request will display an error message and log in the report informing the configuration is completed and ready for productive use.

Hopefully, this blog post gave you a detailed walkthrough of the steps needed to set up and configure the automatic electronic submission of the VAT Return. With this one-time setup, you can benefit from a seamless integration between your business system and SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition.

The integration with the cloud edition is available for a number of supported compliance reports per country/region. To know the reports supported with each business system, access the Supported Compliance Tasks and use the search and filter options to find the reports you want to submit and the business system you have.

entry.title: Recap: SAP Document and Reporting Compliance Virtual Summit 2025 ‚Äì Insights and Impact
entry.content:
It began with a simple question in the chat: ‚ÄúWhere are you joining from?‚Äù Within moments, responses lit up the screen ‚Äî Bangalore, Tokyo, Singapore. Then came S√£o Leopoldo, Paris, Buenos Aires, and Berlin. The SAP Document and Reporting Compliance Virtual Summit 2025 was underway, and it was clear: this isn‚Äôt just an annual virtual event ‚Äî it is truly a global dialogue.

From the first keynote to the final Q&A, the summit reflected the shared challenges and ambitions of compliance professionals across continents. Whether navigating new tax mandates or exploring AI-powered reporting, this community of SAP customers, partners and SAP experts came together on September 25 to learn, connect, and shape the future of digital compliance.

With 4,400 registrants and over 1,350 participants dialing-in from nearly every continent, this year‚Äôs summit reaffirmed its role as a global platform for collaboration, innovation, and learning.

From Strategy to Execution: Empowering Global Compliance

The event opened with a keynote by Sergey Shvedov, SVP and Chief Product Officer of SAP Globalization, who outlined SAP‚Äôs strategy on end-to-end compliance worldwide. He emphasized SAP‚Äôs four-pillar strategy: Global coverage, continuous legal updates, extensibility, and audit-ready processes to help customers navigate evolving regulatory landscapes.

Customer Voices: Real-World Journeys and Lessons

This year‚Äôs summit spotlighted customer stories that brought SAP Document and Reporting Compliance to life:

  • Jubin Sharma from Nestl√© shared their journey implementing SAP Document and Reporting Compliance to streamline tax and reporting processes across multiple regions.
  • Pedro Castro from SumUp demonstrated how SAP Document and Reporting Compliance accelerated invoice processing and payment cycles, improving operational agility.
  • Crimson Partners, joined by their customer Roche, delivered a joint session that showcased how partner-driven expertise can help customers scale compliance globally with one process and one solution. While Roche leverages Crimson‚Äôs support in specific countries, the session highlighted how collaborative planning and technical alignment ‚Äî enabled by SAP Document and Reporting Compliance ‚Äî can streamline implementation and daily operations across diverse jurisdictions.

These sessions underscored how SAP Document and Reporting Compliance is not just a compliance tool, but a strategic enabler for transforming compliance operations.

Innovation in Action and Practical Guidance

The event also brought SAP experts to address the latest roadmap updates and product enhancements. Topics ranged from smarter e-invoicing and AI-driven reporting to localization of cash flow statements and extensibility frameworks for universal coverage.

The summit concluded with a practical overview session offering configuration tips and implementation best practices ‚Äî making the full set of recordings a valuable resource for both strategic and hands-on guidance.

Access the Information Package

All session recordings and slides are now available in the Information Package. Whether you attended live or are catching up, we invite you to explore the materials and continue the conversation.

Thank you to all the attendees, speakers, customers and partners who contributed to making this event a resounding success. Your participation and engagement are the driving force of this community.

While the summit is wrapped up, the journey towards mastering compliance is ongoing. Stay tuned for upcoming events, webinars, and resources from SAP that will continue to support your compliance journey.

We look forward to welcoming you to our next events as we continue to unlock the future of compliance together.

Learn more about SAP‚Äôs localized solutions at sap.com/localization and join our Localization community.

entry.title: SAP Document and Reporting Compliance Belgium: Electronic Invoice in Utilities using Extensibility
entry.content:
You want to enable your system to create electronic documents for invoices posted in Utilities using SAP Document and Reporting Compliance. In this blog, we‚Äôll show you an example on how this can be achieved using extensibility.  

Before you begin ensure that you have implemented the SAP Notes listed in 2424886 - Electronic Document Processing for Belgium: Implementation Overview. You can also refer the SAP Help Portal for more information, see Electronic Document Processing.
Ensure you have also implemented the SAP Notes listed in 2736880 - eDocument EU PEPPOL: Overview note for IS-U.

Steps to Create Electronic Documents

  • Create eDocument Class
    1. Create 'ZCL_EDOCUMENT_BE_ISU' eDocument class by inheriting CL_EDOCUMENT_EU_ISU class.
    2. Add the CONSTRUCTOR method in the ZCL_EDOCUMENT_BE_ISU eDocument class to map the 'Z' eDocument IS-U class name to the field ms_edocument-edocument_class.‚ÄØ
    3. Redefine the method DETERMINE_PROCESS to assign the processes BEINV and BEINVIN.
    4. Use the table TFK003EDOC to configure eDocument type against the accounting document type.
    Example:

    Country/Region 

    Application Area 

    Document Type 

    eDocument Type 

    IN 

    Utility Company 

    FA 

    BE_INV 

    ‚ÄØ5. Add the class CL_EDOC_PROCESS as Friends of 'ZCL_EDOCUMENT_BE_ISU' eDocument class.‚ÄØ

    Sample Code for CONSTRUCTOR and DETERMINE_PROCESS method:  
    Constructor method signature: 

METHOD constructor.
 super->constructor( io_source_data                 = io_source_data
                      iv_edoc_guid                   = iv_edoc_guid
                      iv_land                        = iv_land
                      iv_update_task                 = iv_update_task
                      iv_generic_badi_filter_adaptor = iv_generic_badi_filter_adaptor
                      iv_simulate_for_email_option = iv_simulate_for_email_option ).

  ms_edocument-land                   = 'BE'.
  ms_edocument-edocument_class        = 'ZCL_EDOCUMENT_BE_ISU'.
ENDMETHOD.
METHOD determine_process.
    CASE ms_edocument-edoc_type.
      WHEN 'BE_INVIN'.
        ms_edocument-process = 'BEINVIN'.
        ms_edocument-process_version = '0001'.
      WHEN OTHERS.
        CASE ms_edocument-interface_type.
          WHEN 'AIF_PROXY' OR 'STANDARD'.
            ms_edocument-process = 'BEINV'.
*           reference process is 'EUINV'
            ms_edocument-process_version = '0001'.
          WHEN OTHERS.
            MESSAGE e162(edocument) INTO gv_error_txt.
            raise_edoc_exception( ).
        ENDCASE.
    ENDCASE.
ENDMETHOD.

 

  • Create Factory Class
    1. Create a 'Z' factory class to get the instance of eDocument IS-U class by inheriting CL_EDOC_FACTORY class and redefine its method CREATE_EDOC_INSTANCE. 
    Example: ZCL_EDOC_FACTORY_BE_ISU
    2. Configure this 'Z' eDocument factory class in the view EDOFACTORYV using the transaction SM30.

    Source Type‚ÄØ 

    Factory Class‚ÄØ 

    ISU_INVOIC‚ÄØ 

    ‚ÄòZ‚Äô factory class name (your factory class that you just created)‚ÄØ 


    Sample Code:
METHOD create_edoc_instances.

    DATA: lv_land_iso      TYPE edoc_land,
          lv_error_txt     TYPE string,
          ls_source_header TYPE edoc_src_header,
          lo_edocument     TYPE REF TO zcl_edocument_be_isu.

    CLEAR: lv_land_iso,
           lv_error_txt,
           ls_source_header,
           lo_edocument,
           et_edocument_obj.

* Country
    ls_source_header = io_source->get_header( ).
    CALL FUNCTION 'COUNTRY_CODE_SAP_TO_ISO'
      EXPORTING
        sap_code  = ls_source_header-land
      IMPORTING
        iso_code  = lv_land_iso
      EXCEPTIONS
        not_found = 1
        OTHERS    = 2.
    IF sy-subrc <> 0.
      MESSAGE e881(b1) WITH ls_source_header-land INTO lv_error_txt.
    ENDIF.
    IF lv_land_iso <> 'BE'.
      RETURN.
    ENDIF.

    CREATE OBJECT lo_edocument 
      EXPORTING
        io_source_data = io_source
        iv_update_task = iv_update_task.

    APPEND lo_edocument TO et_edocument_obj.

  ENDMETHOD.

  • Mapping Class
    1. We have a generic mapping class CL_EDOC_MAP_UBL_ISU. If you need to enhance the mapping logic, you can use the EDOC_ADAPTOR BAdI's method SET_OUTPUT_DATA. For more details, refer to Enhancements for Electronic Documents.
    Alternatively, you can implement your own custom mapping class. 
    2. Configure your mapping class in the view EDOMAPCLASSDETV using the transaction SM30.‚ÄØ
    Example:

    eDocument Process 

    Version 

    Interface ID 

    eDocument Type 

    Source Type 

    Mapping Class 

    EUINV 

    1 

    UBL_INVOICE_TRANSM

    BE_INV 

    ISU_INVOIC 

    <Your Z mapping class or CL_EDOC_MAP_UBL_ISU> 

     

  • Maintain the Required Customizations
    Apart from maintaining Master Data, Customizing and Integration as explained in the SAP Help Portal, you must also configure the company code for the following IS-U source type.

    1.  Activate company code for ISU_INVOIC source type in the view EDOCOMPANYACTIV for eDocument creation.
    Example:

    Company Code‚ÄØ 

    Source Type‚ÄØ 

    Application Active‚ÄØ 

    <Your company code>‚ÄØ 

    ISU_INVOICE‚ÄØ 

    X‚ÄØ 


By following these steps, you can efficiently create electronic documents for invoices in the utilities sector, ensuring compliance and enhancing operational efficiency. 

Don't forget to test it thoroughly. 

We hope this blog post was useful for you! You can leave a comment here or continue browsing our‚ÄØcommunity‚ÄØfor more blog posts on SAP Document and Reporting Compliance topics. 

Looking forward to seeing you here again!

entry.title: Enhancing Your Understanding of Peru's Inventory and Balance Ledger Report: Updates to Documentation
entry.content:
I‚Äôm Mait√™, a User Assistance Developer in SAP Globalization, working in the financial area. As part of my role, I‚Äôm happy to share with you the latest updates to the documentation for the Peru Inventory and Balance Ledger report in SAP Document and Reporting Compliance. Explore the highlights below to discover how these improvements can help with the report!

The Report

The Peru Inventory and Balance Ledger report is currently available in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, and SAP S/4HANA. The report organizes general ledger balances into subledgers across fourteen electronic accounting books, following Peru's PCGE (Plan Contable General Empresarial) and SUNAT (Superintendencia Nacional de Aduanas y de Administraci√≥n Tributaria) requirements. 

Recent Documentation Improvements

To help you better understand the Inventory and Balance Ledger report, we have enhanced our documentation with a new page. This addition provides details on specific fields, grouped by configuration settings and characteristics. Our goal is to clarify the relationships between certain fields in the report output and the configurations made by you before running the report.

New page added to the SAP Help Portal

 

Structured Tables for Clarity

We've organized the documentation into five tables:

  • Table 1:  Fields Related to Financial Statement Version (FSV) and G/L Account Hierarchies

This table highlights fields associated with hierarchy configurations from the app Manage Global Hierarchies, focusing on Financial Statement Versions and G/L Account hierarchy types.

  • Table 2: Fields Related to Alternative Chart of Accounts (COA)

This table details fields related to the alternative COA settings used for specific legal reporting requirements in Peru.

  • Table 3: Fields Tax Number Type and Tax Number Related to Alternative Chart of Accounts (COA)

This table specifies details on tax-related fields which are associated with the alternative COA settings.

  • Table 4: Other Fields in the Report

This table provides information about other fields, explaining their data sources and how the system populates them.

  • Table 5: Optional Fields in the Report

Finally, this table lists optional fields included in our solution and explains how they are populated, though they are not required by SUNAT.

Conclusion

We really hope these documentation updates make your journey through the Inventory and Balance Ledger report easier and more efficient. You can find them in the report documentation linked below:

  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition: Inventory and Balance Ledger 
  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition and SAP S/4HANA: Inventory and Balance Ledger

Feel free to explore these tables on the SAP Help Portal and share your questions or feedback in the comments. They are most welcome!

Last but not least, follow the SAP Document and Reporting Compliance community tag for the latest updates. 

Thank you and until next time,

Mait√™ Bohn

entry.title: Mejorando tu Comprensi√≥n del Libro de Inventarios y Balances de Per√∫: Nueva Documentaci√≥n
entry.content:
Soy Mait√™, desarrolladora de asistencia al usuario en SAP Globalization, y trabajo en el √°rea financiera. Como parte de mi rol, me complace compartir las √∫ltimas actualizaciones en la documentaci√≥n del reporte Libro de Inventarios y Balances de Per√∫ en SAP Document and Reporting Compliance. Explora los aspectos destacados a continuaci√≥n para descubrir c√≥mo estas mejoras pueden ayudarte con el reporte!

El reporte

El Libro de Inventarios y Balances de Per√∫ est√° actualmente disponible en SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition y SAP S/4HANA. El reporte organiza los saldos de las cuentas de mayor en catorce libros, siguiendo los requerimientos del PCGE (Plan Contable General Empresarial) y de la SUNAT (Superintendencia Nacional de Aduanas y de Administraci√≥n Tributaria).

Mejoras recientes en la documentaci√≥n

Para ayudarte a comprender mejor el reporte, hemos a√±adido una p√°gina nueva a la documentaci√≥n. Esta nueva p√°gina proporciona detalles sobre campos espec√≠ficos, agrupados seg√∫n configuraciones y caracter√≠sticas. Nuestro objetivo es aclarar las relaciones entre ciertos campos del reporte y las configuraciones necesarias antes de ejecutarlo.
Nueva p√°gina agregada en SAP Help Portal

 

Tablas estructuradas para mayor claridad

Hemos organizado la documentaci√≥n en cinco tablas:

  • Tabla 1: Campos relacionados con las jerarqu√≠as FSV y G/L Account

Esta tabla destaca los campos asociados con la configuraci√≥n de jerarqu√≠as de la aplicaci√≥n Manage Global Hierarchies y se enfoca en dos tipos de jerarqu√≠a: Financial Statement Versions (FSV) y G/L Account.

  • Tabla 2: Campos relacionados con el plan de cuentas alternativo

Detalla los campos relacionados con la configuraci√≥n del plan de cuentas alternativo usado para requerimientos legales espec√≠ficos en Per√∫.

  • Tabla 3: Campos Tax Number Type y Tax Number relacionados con el plan de cuentas alternativo

Ofrece detalles sobre campos relacionados con impuestos asociados a la configuraci√≥n del plan de cuentas alternativo.

  • Tabla 4: Otros campos en el reporte

Proporciona informaci√≥n sobre otros campos, explicando sus fuentes de datos y c√≥mo los completa el sistema.

  • Tabla 5: Campos opcionales en el reporte

Por √∫ltimo, esta tabla presenta los campos opcionales incluidos en nuestra soluci√≥n y explica c√≥mo los completa el sistema, aunque no son requeridos por la SUNAT.

Conclusi√≥n

Esperamos que estas actualizaciones en la documentaci√≥n faciliten tu trabajo con el reporte Libro de Inventarios y Balances. Puedes encontrarlas en la documentaci√≥n del reporte enlazada abajo:

  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition: Inventory and Balance Ledger
  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition y SAP S/4HANA: Inventory and Balance Ledger

Te invitamos a explorar estas tablas en el SAP Help Portal y a compartir cualquier pregunta o comentarios que tengas. ¬°Ser√°n bienvenidos!

Por √∫ltimo, pero no menos importante, sigue SAP Document and Reporting Compliance en la comunidad para recibir actualizaciones.

Gracias y hasta la pr√≥xima,

Mait√™ Bohn

entry.title: Como a Reforma Tribut√°ria no Brasil Impacta os usu√°rios SAP
entry.content:
Click here for the english version.

A reforma tribut√°ria no Brasil √© um tema de grande relev√¢ncia para empresas que precisam se adaptar a estas mudan√ßas legais. Para os usu√°rios SAP, √© importante entender como a reforma afeta os processos log√≠sticos e financeiros, estar ciente dos prazos de implanta√ß√£o e saber quais s√£o as solu√ß√µes providas pela SAP para garantir uma transi√ß√£o tranquila.

Cronograma de Implementa√ß√£o da Reforma

  • 2026: A reforma tribut√°ria come√ßa a ser testada, com taxas iniciais mais baixas de 0,9% para a Contribui√ß√£o sobre Bens e Servi√ßos (CBS) e 0,1% para o Imposto sobre Bens e Servi√ßos (IBS).
  • 2027: A CBS passa a valer, substituindo PIS e Cofins. A al√≠quota de IPI ser√° zerada, exceto para produtos industrializados na ZFM.
  • 2028: √öltimo ano de ICMS e ISS sem altera√ß√£o.
  • 2029: Elimina√ß√£o gradual do ICMS e ISS, com redu√ß√£o anual de 10% em suas taxas, como parte da substitui√ß√£o pelo IBS.
  • 2033: Ado√ß√£o integral do novo regime tribut√°rio, com a extin√ß√£o de ICMS e ISS.

Entregas da SAP
A SAP est√° comprometida em apoiar seus clientes durante a transi√ß√£o para o novo modelo tribut√°rio. As solu√ß√µes SAP est√£o sendo atualizadas para atender aos novos requisitos legais, garantindo que as empresas possam se adequar √†s mudan√ßas.

SNOTE: Note Analyzer tool
Recomendamos fortemente o uso da ferramenta Note Analyzer para organizar a implementa√ß√£o das SAP Notes desta solu√ß√£o. Consulte a SAP Note 3200109 para obter instru√ß√µes sobre essa ferramenta e utilize o arquivo XML anexo √† SAP Note 3561376 para relacionar as entregas da SAP para a Reforma Tribut√°ria do Brasil. A vers√£o mais recente do Note Analyzer introduz um recurso que exibe a ordem de implementa√ß√£o na coluna "coment√°rios" ap√≥s a importa√ß√£o do XML. Siga esta ordem, mesmo que algumas SAP Notes n√£o sejam relevantes para o seu neg√≥cio. Observe que a ferramenta fornece a ordem correta, mas n√£o uma lista completa dos pr√©-requisitos das SAP Notes. Assim, an√°lises adicionais podem ser necess√°rias para lidar com poss√≠veis depend√™ncias.

Observa√ß√µes importantes durante a implementa√ß√£o das SAP notes
Para cada nota SAP que ser√° implementada, reserve um momento para ler o seu conte√∫do em texto. Desta forma, ser√° poss√≠vel se informar sobre notas pr√©-requisito conhecidas, passos manuais a serem executados antes ou depois da implementa√ß√£o autom√°tica das instru√ß√µes de corre√ß√£o, assim como ficar ciente de outras instru√ß√µes. A leitura do conte√∫do de cada nota a ser implementada pode evitar problemas de implementa√ß√£o e a necessidade de retrabalho.
Al√©m disso, √© muito importante n√£o prosseguir para a implementa√ß√£o de SAP notes subsequentes deixando notas anteriores incorretamente implementadas no sistema (status incompletely implemented), pois isso leva a um sistema corrompido e sem os contextos e objetos necess√°rios para futuras implementa√ß√µes. Portanto, ao implementar uma lista de SAP Notes, assegure-se de que cada nota est√° sendo implementada corretamente e completamente.

Recursos de Apoio

Esta nota, de atualiza√ß√£o frequente, lista as entregas da solu√ß√£o conforme s√£o liberadas para clientes. Esta nota ser√° atualizada regularmente.
  • KBA 3642384 - Brazil Tax Reform Troubleshooting Guide: Al√©m de explicar sobre a entrega da SAP e trazer os links diretos da plataforma Regulatory Change Manager para os assuntos da Reforma Tribut√°ria, este KBA de Troubleshooting auxilia a resolver os poss√≠veis problemas j√° identificados durante a implementa√ß√£o das SAP notes. Ao oferecer solu√ß√µes para problemas comuns, este KBA √© continuamente atualizado para incluir novas informa√ß√µes.

A partir de janeiro de 2026, o preenchimento dos campos dos novos impostos ser√° obrigat√≥rio, com valor jur√≠dico, para documentos fiscais eletr√¥nicos em ambiente de produ√ß√£o. A n√£o conformidade poder√° levar √† rejei√ß√£o das notas fiscais.

Conclus√£o

As notas informativas da SAP listadas acima e o KBA de troubleshooting seguir√£o em constante atualiza√ß√£o para que voc√™ tenha acesso a informa√ß√µes relevantes enquanto atualiza o seu sistema.

entry.title: How the Tax Reform in Brazil Impacts SAP Users
entry.content:
Clique aqui para a vers√£o em portugu√™s.

Tax reform in Brazil is a topic of great relevance for companies that need to adapt to these legal changes. For SAP users, it is important to understand how the reform affects logistical and financial processes, be aware of implementation deadlines, and know what solutions SAP provides to ensure a smooth transition.

Implementation Timeline of the Tax Reform

  • 2026: The tax reform begins to be tested, with initial lower rates of 0.9% for the Contribution on Goods and Services (CBS) and 0.1% for the Tax on Goods and Services (IBS).
  • 2027: CBS comes into effect, replacing PIS and Cofins. The IPI rate will be zeroed, except for industrialized products in the ZFM.
  • 2028: Last year of ICMS and ISS without changes.
  • 2029: Gradual elimination of ICMS and ISS, with an annual reduction of 10% in their rates, as part of the replacement by IBS.
  • 2033: Full adoption of the new tax regime, with the extinction of ICMS and ISS.

SAP Deliverables
SAP is committed to supporting its clients during the transition to the new tax model. SAP solutions are being updated to meet the new legal requirements, ensuring that companies can adapt to the changes.

SNOTE: Note Analyzer tool
We strongly recommend using the Note Analyzer tool to organize the implementation of SAP Notes for this solution. Refer to SAP Note 3200109 for instructions on this tool and use the XML file attached to SAP Note 3561376 to list the SAP deliverables for Brazil's Tax Reform. The latest version of Note Analyzer introduces a feature that displays the implementation order in the "comments" column after importing the XML. Follow this order, even if some SAP Notes are not relevant to your business. Note that the tool provides the correct order but not a complete list of prerequisites for the SAP Notes. Therefore, additional analysis may be necessary to address potential dependencies.

Important observations during the implementation of SAP notes
For each SAP Note to be implemented, take a moment to read its textual content. This way, you can become informed about known prerequisite notes, manual steps to be executed before or after the automatic implementation of correction instructions, and be aware of other instructions. Reading the content of each note to be implemented can help avoid implementation issues and the need for rework.
Moreover, it is crucial not to proceed with the implementation of subsequent SAP Notes, leaving previous notes incorrectly implemented in the system (status: incompletely implemented), as this leads to a corrupted system and the absence of necessary contexts and objects for future implementations. Therefore, when implementing a list of SAP Notes, ensure that each note is implemented correctly and completely.

Support Resources
SAP provides several support resources, including:

  • SAP Work Zone - Brazil - Tax Reform Localization: It allows SAP customers and partners to share information and collaborate on matters related to the Tax Reform. This space is updated daily.
  • The Regulatory Change Manager tool: Announcements of legal changes and planning of solution deliverables.
  • SAP Note 3561376 - Tax Reform Leading SAP Note for reading: It describes the delivery and support strategy for the Brazil Tax Reform solution. This frequently updated SAP Note lists the solution deliverables as they are released to customers. Attached to it is an always-updated XML file to be used on the Note Analyzer, assisting you in the implementation of SAP Notes in the proper order.
  • SAP Note 3637842 - Brazil Tax Reform - Testing Limitations with SEFAZ for reading: This informational SAP Note highlights the processes not yet supported by SAP related to the Tax Reform in Brazil, especially regarding scenarios to be tested with SEFAZ. This note will be updated regularly.
  • KBA 3642384 - Brazil Tax Reform Troubleshooting Guide: In addition to explaining SAP's deliverables and providing direct links to the Regulatory Change Manager platform for Tax Reform topics, this Troubleshooting KBA helps resolve potential issues already identified during the implementation of SAP Notes. By offering solutions to common problems, this KBA is continuously updated to include new information.

SAP ERP - Help Portal

  • CBS and IBS Taxes as Statistical Values in Nota Fiscal
  • Define Tax Situation for CBS and IBS
  • CBS and IBS Tax Situation for Sales
  • Base Amount Changes for CBS and IBS Using TAXBRA
  • Enablement of NBS for CBS and IBS Determination in Purchasing Scenarios
  • Base Amount Changes for CBS and IBS Using TAXBRJ Pricing Procedure
  • Fields Added to Nota Fiscal for CBS and IBS Taxes
  • Nominal Rate Calculation and Nota Fiscal Texts for CBS and IBS in Nota Fiscal Writer
  • Base Amount Changes for CBS and IBS Using RVABRA and RVXBRA Pricing Procedures
  • Determine Tax Situation for CBS and IBS Business Add-In
  • Fields Added for Nominal Rates in Nota Fiscal BAdI Structure
  • Field Added to Nota Fiscal Table for IBS Tax Calculation
  • CBS and IBS Tax Situation for Purchasing
  • Enhanced Tax Determination with Tax Situation for CBS and IBS for Sales Processes
  • Fields Added to Nota Fiscal BAdI and BAPIs structures
  • CBS and IBS Tax Situation for Goods Movement

SAP S/4HANA - Help Portal

  • Base Amount Changes for CBS and IBS Using TAXBRA
  • Enablement of NBS for CBS and IBS Determination in Purchasing Scenarios
  • Base Amount Changes for CBS and IBS Using TAXBRJ Pricing Procedure
  • Fields Added to Nota Fiscal for CBS and IBS Taxes
  • Nominal Rate Calculation and Nota Fiscal Texts for CBS and IBS in Nota Fiscal Writer

  • Determine Tax Situation for CBS and IBS Business Add-In
  • Fields Added for Nominal Rates in Nota Fiscal BAdI Structure
  • Field Added to Nota Fiscal Table for IBS Tax Calculation
  • CBS and IBS Tax Situation for Purchasing
  • Enhanced Tax Determination with Tax Situation for CBS and IBS for Sales Processes
  • Fields Added to Nota Fiscal BAdI and BAPIs structures
  • CBS and IBS Tax Situation for Goods Movement

Implementation Deadline for Customers
SAP customers must have the SAP solutions related to the tax reform fully implemented and tested by December 2025 to ensure compliance with the new obligations starting from January 2026.

Government Validation
Currently, it is possible to test document approval with the fields for the new taxes in SEFAZ's homologation environment, and optionally, to send them in production as well. SEFAZ's production environment will begin validating the new XML fields of NF-e related to the tax reform taxes starting in January 2026. Until that date, filling out these new fields is optional and, even if filled, should not cause rejection in NF-e approval.
From January 2026, filling out the fields for the new taxes will be mandatory, with legal significance, for electronic tax documents in the production environment. Non-compliance may lead to the rejection of the invoices.

Conclusion
The tax reform in Brazil represents a significant legal change, so be mindful of the deadline for compliance.
The SAP informational notes listed above and the troubleshooting KBA will be continuously updated to ensure you have access to relevant information as you update your system.
Utilize the available resources and engage in the Work Zone to clarify any doubts.

entry.title: Electronic Invoices in Poland (KSeF 2.0) with SAP Document and Reporting Compliance
entry.content:
Starting in February or April 2026, depending on your revenue, all Polish invoices will be required to be exchanged through KSeF. Following the postponement of the mandate originally planned for 2024, the Ministry of Finance has released a new KSeF system, KSeF 2.0 with the following timelines:

  • February 1, 2026:
    • Submission of electronic invoices to KSeF is obligatory for companies whose sales value in the previous tax year exceeded PLN 200 million.
    • Receiving e-invoices from KSeF is obligatory for all.

  • April 1, 2026 - submission of electronic invoices to KSeF is obligatory for others.

SAP has therefore updated its global solution SAP Document and Reporting Compliance to enable electronic invoices through KSeF 2.0.  To explore the latest functionalities and gain insights to accelerate your implementation, even if you have already implemented KSeF 1.0, we invite you to join our SAP hosted complimentary webinar:

entry.title: Understanding the Belgium B2B e-Invoicing Mandate and the Plant Abroad Scenario
entry.content:
Introduction

From January 1, 2026, structured B2B e-invoicing will become mandatory in Belgium for transactions between businesses established in Belgium.
The requirement applies to all domestic B2B supplies of goods and services where both supplier and buyer are VAT-registered and established in Belgium.

SAP supports the Belgian B2B e-Invoicing mandate through SAP Document and Reporting Compliance (SAP DRC), which enables businesses to create and transmit Peppol BIS Billing 3.0 XML invoices in full compliance via the Peppol network.

For foundational details, refer to Peppol Participant Registration for Belgian Companies 

 

The ‚ÄúPlant Abroad‚Äù Challenge

Businesses operate through foreign legal entities that maintain fixed establishments in Belgium, often configured in SAP using the Plant Abroad functionality.

Scenario:

  • The head company code is registered in another EU country (e.g., The Netherlands).

  • The company has a Belgian VAT registration and Belgian local address maintained in table T001N.

Transactions are issued under the Belgian VAT number, making them legally in scope of the Belgium e-invoicing mandate.

However, the SAP DRC Belgium B2B e-invoicing solution currently supports only company codes established in Belgium out of the box. This means that for ‚Äúplant abroad‚Äù configurations, extensibility via the SAP DRC standard BAdI .

Workaround: Using the EDOC_ADAPTOR BAdI

Key idea:
Adjust the outbound XML data and replace the seller‚Äôs details (VAT ID, GLN, and address) with the Belgian fixed establishment information before submission to Peppol.

Here are the steps:

Master Data Prerequisite

           Verify that in T001N table:

  •  The Belgian VAT number (e.g., BE012345678) is correctly maintained.       
  •  The address number points to the valid local Belgian establishment address (from ADRC).
    BAdI Implementation for EDOC_ADAPTOR--->SET_OUTPUT_DATA.
    1. Read Belgian VAT ID and address number from T001N table.
    2. Assign the following tags in the EDO_UBL_STANDARD_BUSINESS_DOC2  structure:
StandardBusinessDocument\StandardBusinessDocumentHeader\Sender\Identifier‚Äã

Sender Endpoint Assignment

StandardBusinessDocument\Invoice\AccountingSupplierParty\Party\EndpointID

          

StandardBusinessDocument\Invoice\AccountingSupplierParty\PartyTaxScheme\CompanyID

 

StandardBusinessDocument\Invoice\AccountingSupplierParty\PartyLegalEntity\CompanyID

 

StandardBusinessDocument\Invoice\AccountingSupplierParty\PostalAddress
StandardBusinessDocument\Invoice\AccountingSupplierParty\PostalAddress\StreetName
StandardBusinessDocument\Invoice\AccountingSupplierParty\PostalAddress\CityName
StandardBusinessDocument\Invoice\AccountingSupplierParty\PostalAddress\PostalZone
StandardBusinessDocument\Invoice\AccountingSupplierParty\PostalAddress\CountrySubentity
StandardBusinessDocument\Invoice\AccountingSupplierParty\PostalAddress\Country\IdentificationCode

 

 

 

Expected Outcome:
  • Successful e-Invoice Submission: 

    The generated XML will now contain the correct Belgian VAT ID and Belgian address information in the relevant Peppol BIS 3.0 fields. The invoice passes both SAP DRC validation and Peppol network checks.

  • Sender Identifier must reflect Belgian Information:

    The Belgian VAT ID or GLN is properly reflected in the Standard Business Document Header of the XML.

  • Correct Endpoint Identification for Peppol Transmission:

    The  <Endpoint> under <AccountingSupplierParty> ensures proper routing within the Peppol network using the Belgian VAT ID or GLN. Also, make sure that the tags <CompanyID> reflect correct Belgian VAT.

  • Accurate Representation of the Fixed Establishment:

    The seller‚Äôs postal address represents the Belgian fixed establishment instead of the foreign head office address.

entry.title: Fichier des √âcritures Comptables (FEC)
entry.content:
In France we have a legal requirement to submit a file of accounting entries for the closed fiscal year in a dematerialized format (Article L47 A I ) which is effective from 01.01.2014.

Upon receiving request from the tax authorities, a company has 15 days to prepare and submit the FEC file. In case of failing to deliver the FEC file or in the event of non-compliance, companies could face significant penalties

This file consists of entries after inventory operations, excluding centralization entries and excluding entries for balancing expense and revenue accounts. It includes the entries for the recovery of balances from the previous fiscal year and contains, for each entry, all accounting data present in the company's computerized accounting system, with the first eighteen pieces of information required to correspond, in order, to those listed in the following table:

 

 

Further information about the legal requirements can be found here

Article L47 A - Book of Tax Procedures ‚Äì L√©gifrance

Article A47 A-1 - Livre des proc√©dures fiscales - L√©gifrance

How to generate the FEC file from SAP? 

DRC or DART

Document and Reporting Compliance (DRC)

It enables you to create, process, and monitor electronic documents and statutory reports. As a result, your company stays compliant with local legal obligations.

Statutory reporting has been localized for use by businesses with operations in the country/region and it comprises functions designed for laws and business practices relevant in the country/region.

You can generate the audit file for France using the Run Statutory Reports app. This file is referred to as "FEC - Fichier des √âcritures Comptables".

Further information can be found here

Supported Compliance Tasks by Country/Region | SAP Help Portal

Audit File (FEC) | SAP Help Portal

Data Retention Tool (DART)

The Data Retention Tool (DART) helps SAP users to meet the legal requirements concerning data retention and data transfer for tax auditing. You can use DART to extract and store data that is relevant to tax from SAP applications at regular intervals. DART extracts the data into sequential files and provides tools that you can use to display and evaluate the stored data.

In general, two steps are required in DART to create machine-readable files for the tax auditor.

The first step in DART involves generating extract files that capture data based on the selected company code and areas like FI, CO, SD, and MM, with customizable restrictions.

In the second step, extract files are transformed into view files according to tax auditor specifications by defining which segments are included and how they are combined.

Further information can be found here

Introduction to the Data Retention Tool (DART) | SAP Help Portal

What are the technical prerequisites for FEC solution by DART?

The recommendation from SAP is to be on the highest version of DART with all the latest notes implemented.

you can check the DART version in the SE11.

You should choose there the "TYPE GROUP": DART1. Then click display

 

The most important technical prerequisites are included in this note

2162977 - DART: Order of implementation of notes for FEC - SAP for Me

Depending on release & support package of the relevant system, some of them should have been delivered by default.

Configuration for DART can be checked in SAP Help Portal

Configuration | SAP Help Portal

DART is often pre-configured for FEC by the installed SAP notes. You mainly need to Configure the Extract File Directories and set directory paths

What is the exact business process?

The prerequisite before running these processes is that your fiscal year is completely closed!

1st step Posting of opening balances France

2nd step Create DART extracts

3rd step Generation of the FEC

Posting of opening balances France

Run Program RFOPENPOSTING_FR with Tcode SE38 or Tcode FAGL_FR_03

This report creates opening entries for balance sheet accounts from the previous year in accordance with the French requirement to submit posting data to the French tax authorities.

Based on the account balances and open items on the key date, FI documents are posted and form the basis of the data extract. These postings represent the balance carryforward but do not generate balances.

For these postings, no subledger documents (customer/vendor/Asset Accounting) are written.

No open items are generated.

The report is available for classic General Ledger Accounting and new General Ledger Accounting.

The documents are specially indicated:

1) The document status is 'O' (balance sheet opening entry).

2) The reference transaction is 'GLYEC' (year-end closing document).

3) The documents are posted in period '0' of the carryforward year.

Documents are generated for each account, customer, and vendor. Information about the customer and vendor is stored in the LIFNR/KUNNR fields as well as in the assignment.

The balances of the respective balance sheet accounts are cleared against "Balance Sheet Account - Opening" on the selection screen.

The posted documents can be reversed with the FI reversal transactions (FB08/F.80).

Compare entries with G/L account Balance Tcode FAGLB03

New list RFOPENPOSTING_FR 

Account balance

Posting List

New open posting in the FEC file

Process Data in DART

Settings for data extraction with Tcode FTWP

Go to FTW1A create the DART extract select FR for the language

You can analyze the extract using the transaction FTWF

Generate FEC File

Start the view 2FR_FI01 with transaction FTWH

 

Go in transaction FTWN you can display and export your generated data

How to test FEC file

The validation program is available on the ministry website

Outil de test des fichiers des √©critures comptables (FEC) | Minist√®re de l‚Äô√âconomie des Finances et de la Souverainet√© industrielle et num√©rique

After installation, run the program. The screen is the same as the one used by the authorities. You should fill the field "Entrer le num√©ro alpage du dossier" with your number as the file naming example ("111222333"). This is mandatory.

The second field is optional; you can write the name of your company into this.

Also choose the type of your chart of account on the left column (Type de plan comptable) and the type of the revenue category on the right column (Type de revenus). Then you can upload the file to be tested by clicking on the icon "Selectionner un fichier √° traiter".

Select the relevant local file. After that your can start the test by clicking on the "Valider" button.

At the end of the test, a summary document is generated in PDF format. It is automatically displayed and saved. The first page of the summary contains general information about this validation process.

The second page shows the mandatory fields required by the law and the fields of the actual FEC file next to it.

Additional notes and comments about the file are displayed on the third page. Generally, these notes have two types: in some cases, these are problems what should be solved in order to get correct file from technical aspect. For example, if there are missing data, it is displayed under the heading ‚ÄûDonn√©es absentes‚Äù. There are also informational comments, in these cases the file is technically correct. These are displayed under the heading ‚ÄûObservations compl√©mentaires‚Äù.

entry.title: Explore SAP Localization With the Global Map of Local Versions
entry.content:
In today‚Äôs interconnected world, businesses are growing across borders faster than ever. But with global growth comes local complexity ‚Äî from tax regulations to payroll rules and legal reporting.

Whether you're a consultant, developer, or business user, navigating country-specific requirements and features can be challenging. SAP simplifies this journey with the global map of local versions. This interactive application is your one-stop destination to explore SAP-provided local versions across the globe.

Ready to explore SAP‚Äôs localization capabilities?
Visit sap.com/localization and go global with confidence.

 

What is a local version?

A local version is a set of system functionalities tailored to meet the legal, regulatory, and business requirements of a specific country or region. Think tax reports, payroll rules, or legal reporting formats ‚Äî all built into SAP solutions to enable compliance and efficiency.

 

Key features of the global map

1. Comprehensive coverage

Explore over 1000 local versions for countries and regions. The global map of local versions simplifies your localization journey by offering a holistic view of SAP‚Äôs localization portfolio.

2. Search & filter

Easily find what you need by filtering the interactive map:

  • By Product: Filter by SAP S/4HANA Cloud, SAP SuccessFactors, etc.
  • By Country/Region: Select from a list or use the interactive map.
  • By Deployment Type: Cloud, on-premise
  • By Solution Type: SAP, or Partner solution

The map view provides a visual overview, while the list view offers granular details ‚Äî ideal for consultants preparing rollout plans or developers assessing localization gaps.

 

3. Stay ahead of regulatory changes

Direct links to SAP‚Äôs regulatory change manager help you stay informed about upcoming regulations and how they impact your business. These links are prefiltered for you to continue your localization journey and find prospective regulatory changes.

 

4. Find the right SAP Partner

Need additional localization support? Use the SAP-Qualified Partner-Packaged Solution Finder and search for integrated solutions built, sold, and supported by SAP partners that combine SAP software with industry or line-of-business expertise, services, customizations, or applications.

 

5. Deep dive into SAP business solutions

Want to explore further? Use the direct link to the specific SAP product webpage, access dedicated resources and request a demo to expand your SAP landscape.

 

Realize your global potential with SAP

SAP‚Äôs localization capabilities give you the breadth of coverage and depth of expertise to run your business globally ‚Äî while staying locally compliant.

Visit sap.com/localization and take your business global with confidence.

 

Have you used the global map of local versions for your projects? Share your feedback or tips in the comments below.

entry.title: SII tip for Spain #5C: SII Adjustments for Canary Islands October 2025 - <BienInversion> and "AJ"
entry.content:
As mentioned in the publication SII tip for Spain #5: SII Adjustments for Canary Islands October 2025, the Canary Islands Tax Agency published the Order of July 10, 2025 modifying Order of 11 October 2018  containing a set of changes in the Canary Islands SII format. In the Annex of this Order, the technical specifications are detailed. In that publication, the new regimes and the AIEM adjustment were mentioned.

In that earlier post, we covered the new regimes and the AIEM adjustment.
In this second part, we focus on two additional changes introduced by the Tax Agency:

Key Enhancements for SAP Customers

  1. Capital Goods Identification
    SAP customers operating in the Canary Islands can now identify incoming invoices related to capital goods (Bienes de inversi√≥n).
  2. Adjustment Document Type ‚ÄúAJ‚Äù
    For Travel Agencies (REAV) and Used Goods Schema (REBU), it is now possible to record adjustments using a new document type: AJ.

 

 

 

Capital Goods

Similar to SII-Spain, it is possible to mark certain tax codes as "Capital Goods" relevant.

Configuration path: SAP Customizing Implementation Guide -> Cross-Application Components -> General Application Functions -> eDocument -> Country/Region-Specific Settings -> Spain -> Settings for Electronic IGIC Register Books With SII -> Assign Additional Attributes to Input Tax Codes for IGIC (SSCUI 107267)

In this customizing activity, you can select "Capital Goods" in the "Attributes" column.

When a tax code is marked as Capital Goods, invoices using this tax code will populate the XML tag:

<BienInversion>S</BienInversion>

Adjustment documents (REBU and REAV)

The special VAT schemas REBU (used goods) or REAV (travel agencies) calculate IGIC and tax base amounts based on estimated profit margins for the invoicing period. At year-end, margins are recalculated, which may require adjustments.

(*) This calculation is not part of the SAP standard.

Once the new margin is calculated, adjustments to IGIC and tax base amounts (positive or negative) can be reported to the Tax Agency using the new document type ‚ÄúAJ‚Äù.

Configuration Path: SAP Customizing Implementation Guide -> Cross-Application Components -> General Application Functions -> eDocument -> Country/Region-Specific Settings -> Spain -> Settings for Electronic IGIC Register Books With SII -> Assign SII Attributes to Document Types for IGIC (SSCUI 102992). Mark the relevant accounting document type as "AJ".

 

The IGIC adjustment will be reported as follows:

 

Validation Rules:

  • Fields not reported in the XML message:
    • <FechaOperacion> (Tax fulfillment)
    • Block <Contraparte> (receiver)
  • Mandatory fields:
    • <TipoImpositivo> 
    • <BaseImponible>
    • <CuotaRepercutida>
  • Fixed fields:
    • <TipoFactura> is "AJ"
    • <ClaveRegimenEspecialOTrascendencia> must be either ‚Äú03‚Äù (REBU) or ‚Äú05‚Äù (REAV)
    • <TipoDesglose> must contain only <DesgloseFactura>
    • <TipoNoExenta> = ‚ÄúS1‚Äù 

 

 

 

Disclaimer

This blog post is intended for informational purposes only and reflects a simplified configuration approach based on current legal and system understanding. It does not constitute legal or implementation advice. SAP system behavior may vary depending on version, scope, and customer-specific settings. For full compliance and implementation support, please consult your SAP implementation partner or legal advisor.

 

Related links

In case of additional questions, you can refer to the official SAP documentation:

  • Electronic Tax Register Books with SII in S/4HANA Public Cloud
  • Electronic Tax Register Books with SII in S/4HANA Private Cloud
  • Electronic Tax Register Books with SII in ERP

Other SII tips and community discussions:

  • Spain ‚Äì SAP Document and Reporting Compliance ‚Üí Related Links ‚Üí Community Section

entry.title: Statutory Reporting and EFD-Reinf: Mass Rectification for the R-4000 Series
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

We're excited to share a new feature in the EFD-Reinf report for Brazil, specifically for users of the Statutory Reporting framework: Mass Rectification for the R-4000 Series. This enhancement is set to transform how you manage corrections for the EFD-Reinf R-4000 series.

Introducing Mass Rectification in R-4000 Series

With the new Mass Rectification functionality, users can now easily generate rectification files for multiple events at once during the Correction Phase of your reporting tasks. This means faster and more efficient handling of corrections when you need to rectify several events for a given company and branch.

How It Works

When running the Brazil EFD-Reinf Periodic Files task, you'll notice a new Run Mass Rectification checkbox in the selection criteria popup, as seen below:

Here‚Äôs what you need to know about the options:

  • File ID for Rectification:
    • When a specific File ID is entered in this field, the system will create the rectification file only for the provided File ID (i.e., only the selected event will be corrected). 
  • Run Mass Rectification Checkbox:
    • If you select the Run Mass Rectification flag without entering a File ID, rectification files will be generated for all eligible R-4000 series events for the specified Company Code and Business Place.
    • This is especially useful when multiple corrections are needed across several events, saving you significant manual effort!

Additionally, you can schedule or run this task immediately with the standard Run Options for background processing that is recommend for large volume of files, making it even easier to fit rectification into your processes.

Why Use Mass Rectification?

  • Faster Corrections: Generate rectification files for many events in a single run.
  • Greater Flexibility: Correct either specific events by ID or all relevant events for your company and branch at once.
  • Improved Compliance: Stay up to date with changing requirements and ensure your data is always accurate.

Learn More

To explore this new functionality and stay updated on further enhancements, check out these SAP Help Portal resources:

  • Document and Reporting Compliance
  • EFD-Reinf Report

 

We value your feedback!
If you have any questions or suggestions for future topics, please leave your comment below.

See you in the next post!



Statutory Reporting for Brazil Team

entry.title: Mass Actions in Statutory Reporting - Enhancing Compliance Management
entry.content:
The Evolution of the Tax Function 

Not too long ago, multinational companies relied on a more local approach for managing tax compliance. Each country had its own dedicated tax expert, someone who truly understood the local regulations and handled everything from VAT returns to audit responses within their territory. This model worked well in many ways. It offered deep local knowledge and quick responsiveness when needed. However, it also came with its own set of challenges, especially around consistency, oversight, and cost. 

As businesses expanded and sought greater efficiency, many shifted towards a centralized model. Shared service centres were established to manage tax and statutory reporting across multiple countries from a single location. This transition brought clear advantages. Processes became more streamlined, control improved, and costs were reduced. At the same time, it introduced a new challenge, teams that previously focused on just one country were now responsible for a global compliance portfolio. 

In this new environment, shared service teams need tools that help them scale their efforts, automate routine tasks, and ensure consistency across regions. Mass Actions and Scheduling in Statutory Reporting address these challenges for global teams.  

The Accountant‚Äôs Daily Reality‚ÄîBefore and After 

Before these features, here is what a day looked like during the VAT season: 

  • Log in. 
  • Manually generate reports for each country. 
  • Review and validate them. 
  • Submit them one by one. 
  • Chase down approvals. 
  • Update submission statuses. 
  • Track what was accepted, what failed, and what needed to be resubmitted. 

Repeat this for 5 reports per country √ó 10 countries. That is 50 reporting tasks per month. 

Mass Actions 

With Mass Actions, we can now execute bulk actions across all reports in one go. The steps include: - 

  1. Selecting the reports we want. 
  2. Choosing the action - Generate, Send Report Run for Approval, Update Report Run Submission Status or Submit Report Run. 
  3. Hitting "Generate/Send/Update/Submit". 

SAP handles the rest. 

Need to manage reports for France, Norway, Columbia and Poland whenever the local regulations demand? Instead of processing each report manually and individually, Mass Actions allow Business users to handle all these requirements together by selecting the relevant reports, executing the needed steps, and letting the system take care of the rest.

 

Problem We are Solving 

With Mass actions we have 

  • Reduced Manual Effort 
  • Lower Operational Costs 
  • Increased Productivity 

Here is a simplified overview of a monthly VAT process flow using Mass Actions: 

 

1. Select Required Tasks

 

2. Choose Action - Generate Report Run

 

 

3. Execute Reporting Tasks in Bulk

 

4. Review Logs to track progress

With Mass actions we have: 

  •  Efficiency 

Save hours of manual, repetitive work with bulk processing capabilities. 

Streamline compliance activities across countries and report types from a single interface. 

  •  Scalability 

Easily manage a growing volume of reports 

Support centralized operations across multiple jurisdictions without additional overhead. 

  • Flexibility 

Adapt to various reporting requirements across entities, countries, and regulatory formats. 

Configure actions and schedules to fit both legal mandates and internal business timelines. 

To Summarize 

Mass Actions in Statutory Reporting provides a practical way to manage large volumes of statutory reports efficiently. They enable centralized processing, reduce manual effort, and ensure that recurring tasks run reliably in the background helping organizations stay compliant across multiple countries and reporting cycles. 

The follow-up section of this blog, which explores the Scheduling feature of Run Statutory Reporting, is available via the link provided below.

 

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/mass-actions-in-statutory-reporting-part-2-scheduling-for-timely-execution/ba-p/14273540

entry.title: Mass Actions in Statutory Reporting ‚Äì Part 2: Scheduling for Timely Execution
entry.content:
Introduction 

In the previous blog, we explored how Mass Actions simplify statutory reporting by allowing users to perform a single action across multiple tasks. This feature reduces manual effort across tasks. 

Among the available options, Schedule Mass Action adds even more value by letting users automate actions to run at a specific time aligned with reporting deadlines. In this follow-up, we will dive into how scheduling ensures timely compliance in your reporting process. 

Let us take a closer look at how to set it up and make the most of it. 

Scheduling Mass Actions. 

Let us say we want to generate all monthly VAT reports on the 1st of every month, review them on the 2nd, and submit them by the 5th. We set this up once, and it runs like clockwork. 

Even when employees are away or simply overseeing the process, reports continue to generate and queue automatically in the background. The system knows. 

The scheduling process flow follows three targeted steps: 

1. Choose the required Job Template ‚Äì 
Choose a job template and assign a clear job name for easy identification. It works on two scheduling modes: 

a.‚ÄØ Schedule reporting actions to recur on fixed calendar dates: Ideal for known deadlines (e.g., 1st of every month). 

b.‚ÄØ Schedule reporting action to recur per period based on different reporting deadlines: Perfect for fiscal cycles or quarterly returns. 

‚ÄØ 

This dual-template approach exists to accommodate the different reporting rhythms and regulatory requirements faced by multinational organizations. 

2. Scheduling Options 
Define a start date/time, an optional end date, and a recurrence pattern (e.g., monthly, quarterly). 

3. Set the required parameters 
Specify essential details such as the reporting entity, report type, or period - tailored to your use case. 

Once scheduled, your reports run automatically. Users can focus on higher-value activities, knowing compliance processing happens reliably in the background. 

With Scheduling, we can now: 

  • Ensures Timely Submissions 

Schedules actions to run at the right time, helping meet reporting deadlines without manual effort. 

  • Reduces Manual Workload 

Eliminates the need to trigger actions manually, especially useful for recurring or large-volume reports. 

  • Improves Efficiency and Planning 

Allows users to plan by scheduling tasks in advance, reducing last-minute pressure. 

 

To summarize 

Scheduling in Mass Actions allows users to automate statutory reporting tasks based on specific timelines. Instead of executing actions like Generate, Submit, or Approve immediately, users can schedule them to run at a future date and time, often aligned with reporting deadlines. This is especially useful when managing recurring or time-sensitive reports across multiple entities or periods. 

Hope after reading this blog post it will provide some useful insights about the features ‚Äì Mass Actions & Scheduling. Feel free to provide your feedback, suggestions, questions in comments below.

entry.title: KSeF 2.0 Test Environment: Setup and Integrate Your System with the Cloud Edition
entry.content:
The original plan from the Poland authorities to introduce mandatory e-invoices through KSeF in 2024 was postponed. The delay was used to rebuild the infrastructure and launch KSeF 2.0. With that, some of the changes are reflected in the following:

  • The new KSeF 2.0 is not compatible with KSeF 1.0, meaning it significantly impacts how you setup and integrate your system.
  • A new FA (3) schema version for electronic invoice formatting is introduced.
  • The authentication method based on token will be phased out by 2026. As a result, SAP will support only certificate-based authentication for KSeF 2.0 (only tokens were supported for KSeF 1.0).

You can already setup your business system for the new invoice format required with KSef 2.0 and update the integration requirements to use SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition. 

For now, you can connect with the KSeF 2.0 test environment, that is, the sandbox environment that allows you to test the integration with KSeF, to exchange electronic customer invoices if you use SAP ERP, SAP S/4HANA or SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition. This test connection does not require authentication with real token or certificate.

Please note that the steps described in this blog post are only valid for the test environment of KSeF 2.0 and should be implemented in your test environment only. Existing integration remains applicable for production environment of KSeF 1.0 until the legal mandate comes into effect, at the end of January 2026. You can expect a subsequent post with details about the pre-production and production environments of KSeF 2.0, and also what to do when KSeF system is unavailable.

Be aware that KSeF has different environments that should be assigned to different service plans of the cloud edition, as follows:

  • KSeF 2.0 Test Environment - Test Plan of the cloud edition
  • KSeF 2.0 Demo (Pre-Prod) Environment - Test Plan of the cloud edition
  • KSeF 2.0 Production Environment: Standard Plan of the cloud edition

 

Depending on when you integrated your business system with the cloud edition, the steps to setup your system for KSeF 2.0 can vary. Before starting, make sure the E-Invoices Through KSeF (PL) process is active in the Activate Processes app - the process that should be activated is the same if you configured your system for KSeF 1.0 (in this case, it is already active), or if you are configuring your system for KSeF 2.0 now.

For the integration, you need to perform the general integration settings. For that, consider according to your business system: 

  • Integrating All Other Processes and Countries/Regions with SAP ERP 
  • Integrating All Other Processes and Countries/Regions with SAP S/4HANA or SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition 

Please, also consider the following:

  • You should perform all the steps described under the Establishing Connection from Cloud Edition to Business System section, including configuring the Cloud Connector. This is a technical prerequisite and does not require additional license.
  • If you use processes other than Peppol Exchange, Argentina, Romania, Serbia, or Slovakia, you might have done these steps already and there are no additional steps for now.
  • If you have onboarded the cloud edition after April 2023, you don‚Äôt need to create a new service binding when performing the steps for the new integration. 
  • Once these settings are completed, the system automatically sets the integration with KSeF 2.0.

For all scenarios listed, no process-specific configuration is required as the authentication with the test environment does not require a real certificate.

If you have configured your system for KSeF 1.0, you have already made process-specific configuration using your NIP number. The system ignores that configuration, but you can also delete it, if you prefer. For KSeF 2.0, new process-specific configuration will be made available soon.

Besides the integration with the cloud edition, there are steps that you have to perform in your business systems related to the new invoice format, as follows:

  • Implement SAP Note 367668.
  • Do the configuration to adapt your business system to the legal mandate. For more information, see:
    • SAP S/4HANA or SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition  
    • SAP ERP

Even if you already implemented KSeF 1.0, please review the complete Customizing section, as new configuration nodes and new configuration values have been introduced with KSeF 2.0.

  • In the Define Process Communication Through Cloud Services Customizing activity, update the Service option to Cloud Edition: Standard Integration. 

For more information, you can access the Regulatory Change Manager for Mandatory e-Invoicing through KSeF in Poland. 

Best regards,

entry.title: KSeF 2.0 Test Environment: Automate the Retrieval of Electronic Documents with the Cloud Edition
entry.content:
You are setting up your system for the new invoice format required for KSeF 2.0 and want to understand how to test automated retrieval of invoices from the tax authority portal to achieve end-to-end processing of electronic documents.

With the Schedule Jobs app in SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition, you can create one job that automates the retrieval of supplier or self-billing invoices from the tax authority portal to your business system (for example, SAP S/4HANA or SAP ERP) . This makes the following activities in your business system obsolete:

  • Processing eDocument Inbound Messages
  • Processing Incoming Messages with Additional Filters
  • Processing eDocument Status Message
  • Processing Status Messages for Multiple eDocuments

Meaning, you no longer use the eDocument Inbound Message Handler for these activities. Instead, you use Schedule Jobs app.

How it works?

  1. You schedule a job in the SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition. The system automatically creates a request based on the job configuration.
  2. The cloud edition takes invoice data from Krajowy System e-Faktur (KSeF), a platform from the Polish tax authority used to exchange electronic invoices.
  3. The cloud edition decrypts retrieved invoices, creates visualization as PDF files and pushes to the destination business system selected for the job.
  4. The business system creates the electronic document and updates its status. The XML (FA(3)) and PDF files are available in the history of the electronic document. Here you can also check if any duplicate documents were retrieved.
    Note: To see the attached XML (FA(3)) and PDF files, select the electronic document and open Attachments in the Manage Electronic Documents app, or History in the eDocument Cockpit transaction.

Test Use Cases

In this blog, I share details on two key scenarios for downloading invoices that you might want to apply with the Schedule Jobs app:

  • Downloading purchase invoices
  • Downloading sales invoices for self-billing

Prerequisites

You have already performed the general integration settings for test environment as described in this blog: KSeF 2.0 Test Environment: Setup and Integrate Your System with the Cloud Edition.

Now, you can test configuring automated jobs for retrieving your invoices from tax authority portal using the Schedule Jobs app.  To access the app, go to the SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition launchpad in your associated SAP BTP subaccount. See Scheduling Jobs.

Configuration is guided through a step-by-step wizard:

  1. Define the general settings for the job, by selecting:
    • Process Flow:  Retrieving Documents for E-Invoices Through KseF (PL)
    • Identification Number: Select the NIP number you have set for communication type E-Invoices Through KSeF 2.0 (PL). See Managing Communication Settings.

  2. Configure additional properties required by KSeF 2.0 to provide the data to the cloud edition. This is where you pay attention to achieve the scenarios.

    Scenario 1: You want to schedule job to retrieve invoices where your company is the buyer.

    • subjectType: Subject2 (Buyer)
    • dateType: Issue (Use for KSeF 2.0 test environment).
      Note: Later, for production, it‚Äôs recommended to use PermanentStorage (based on archival date) to avoid missing invoices.
    • Buyer Identifier Type: Select Nip or VatUe. 
    • Buyer Identifier Value: Enter the identification number of your company according to the type you selected.

    Scenario 2: You want to schedule a job to retrieve invoices issued under self-invoicing mode where your company acts as the seller.

    • subjectType: Subject1 (Seller)
    • dateType: Issue (Use for KSeF 2.0 test environment).
      Note: Later, for production, it‚Äôs recommended to use PermanentStorage (based on archival date) to avoid missing invoices.
    • sellerNIP: Your company NIP number
    • isSelfInvoicing: Select the checkbox

  3. Define the frequency of your job. Example configuration can be:
    • Every 2 hours ‚Äì the cloud edition will send a request for retrieving the invoices every 2 hours and will get the invoices created in between.
    • One-Time ‚Äì you can use this to get the invoices for a certain period in the past, for example, the period before the first run of your recurring job.

  4. Select the destination you created for the business system in which you want to receive the documents. See Setting Up Connectivity.

Once you save your configuration, you can monitor the results of your job runs ‚Äì time details, status, results, troubleshooting steps. See Viewing Results of a Job Run.

For more information on KSeF 2.0 related features covered by SAP, you can access the Regulatory Change Manager for Mandatory e-Invoicing through KSeF in Poland.
